programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave wins a furniture unit, Darrell gets hold of some 1970s sound equipment, and Barry lays his hands on something truly vintage.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les's relationship deteriorates further as a string of problems in the warehouse threatens to bleed the business dry.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions are at an all-time high in the store as Seth and Les tussle for power and Ashley intervenes when the chaos begins to affect business.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three chefs are ready to scorch their rivals for a chance to win $10,000. One chef decides to cheese it up a little and the judges feast on Moroccan-inspired dishes in the final.

programme.title: The Curse of Oak Island
programme.desc: Brothers Marty and Rick Lagina return to Oak Island and begin preparations for a major excavation in the Money Pit.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: As the $10,0000 bounty deadline dawns, one team races against the clock to get their monster gator back across state lines, but it remains to be seen whether they can make it in time.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: A lorry drives off a bridge two days before Christmas, leaving several vehicles dangling over a raging river. A new recruit to Jamie's team has to deal with the crisis.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick looks for a knockout deal on a set of handprints signed by Sylvester Stallone. Meanwhile, Chumlee enters an arm-wrestling competition.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Revolutionary war documents signed by King George III show up in the shop. Plus, Chumlee checks out a pair of Pushman Scooters.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: The Man Who Killed Richard III
programme.desc: Documentary about the king's death at the Battle of Bosworth, exploring the conspiracy and intrigue behind the conflict and attempting to identify who killed Richard.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Tale of Two Sisters
programme.desc: Jackie Kennedy's relationship with her sister Lee, which was a source of support in the wake of her husband's death but fell apart after her second marriage.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Dramatised account of 19th-century serial killer Mary Ann Cotton, aka the Black Widow, who travelled around the north east of England, and murdered men for the life insurance.

programme.title: The Good Nazi
programme.desc: The story of Major Karl Plagge, a high-ranking Nazi officer who risked his own life to save hundreds of people, in a story reminiscent of Schindler's List.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Hanbury Hall in Droitwich. Among the rarities brought in to be valued are a jacket designed by Peter Blake, which proves less valuable for being nibbled by a ferret, a nude painting and a sketch of Napoleon on his deathbed. Andy McConnell examines the oldest piece of glass he has seen in his career, and Fiona is challenged to spot a 2500-year-old Greek vessel among three fakes.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Salisbury in Wiltshire to Castle Cary, Somerset, visiting a world-famous tourist spot that has been captivating visitors since the Victorian era. He also takes to the air in Yeovil and tries his hand at clothmaking the 19th-century way.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the third leg of his journey from London to Newton Abbot, Michael Portillo travels from Taunton to Minehead. Along the way he explores a church, finds out just what it takes to operate a 19th-century signal box and summons all his strength to move a 110-ton steam locomotive.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Trentham Gardens near Stoke-on-Trent, where the experts value a selection of rare finds from the region's historic potteries, as well as a brooch that belonged to flying ace Amy Johnson and a portable road map. Plus, Fiona is challenged to spot the cheap imitation in a collection of gold necklaces.

programme.title: Wild Caribbean
programme.desc: The region's mysterious side comes to light during a journey from the rainforests of Panama to the Barrier Reef of the Americas - the world's second largest coral system. The programme also explores the wildlife on the shores of Central America, including killer whales and thimble jellyfish in the deep waters near Honduras.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Liverpool to Manchester Line - The First Modern Railway
programme.desc: The Liverpool and Manchester Railway, which revolutionised rail travel when it opened in 1830, becoming the first railway to have a signalling system among many other things.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Search for Hitler's Bomb
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at Nazi experiments into atomic weapons, examining how close they got to developing a functioning nuclear device before the end of the war.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Nazi Gold Train
programme.desc: Part one of two. The search for a missing train containing Nazi treasure, which was believed to have been hidden in the mountains of Poland.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the penultimate leg of his journey Michael Portillo travels from Lynton to Exeter. He gets up close to a piece of natural history, visits a garden used as a viewing platform for public hangings and examines a timepiece like no other.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo starts off in Exmouth on the final leg of his journey to Newton Abbot. Along the way, he goes out to sea with an RNLI lifeboat crew, visits a stormy coastal railway and has an encounter with his boyhood hero.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: Jupiter is big, very dangerous and has moons as big as planets, but the more we learn we must conclude this giant is less of a planet and more of a failed star.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Peace evades the inmates of Slade Prison, and Fletcher's bid to find a little tranquillity seems destined to fail. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Blanco ends up in the prison hospital, where he fears he is about to shuffle off this mortal coil and entrusts the whereabouts of his stashed fortune to fellow inmate Fletch, who is sharing a ward with him. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber takes up boxing and enters the prison championships. He is hot favourite to win until Fletcher is given the task of fixing the contest and nobbling his cell-mate. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Peter Vaughan.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki investigates a man's apparent suicide and begins to suspect foul play after two more deaths occur, leading to recently released mental patient David Nicholson being accused of their murder. While the doctor treating Nicholson is adamant that he is no threat to anyone, the pathologists are not convinced - especially when a connection with the original victim emerges.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: When Justice Isn't Enough - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of three. The shocked Sun Hill relief pull out all the stops to find the killer of popular colleague Lance Powell. As a tearful Laura Bryant is sent home on compassionate leave, a witness provides a breakthrough, and the trail of evidence leads back to Michael Keenan, the barman at gay club Radar. Amid the emotional turmoil, Phil Hunter accompanies Kate as she registers the birth of their son, and is devastated to learn she's leaving to live with her mother in Cardiff.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Blue Watch are caught up in a horrific street disturbance when vigilantes set fire to a suspected pedophile's car. Starring Andrew Kazamia.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, which sees five friends from Cardiff competing to answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of popular culture and general knowledge. They then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV Live: Royal Ascot
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the fourth and final day of the prestigious festival, including feature race the 3.30 Magners Cheltenham Gold Cup Steeple Chase, plus races at 1.30, 2.10, 2.50 and 4.10. With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Jason, Christine, Karen and Mark work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Britain's Best Walks with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: The expert walker's favourite river walk finds her in Devon, following the green tree canopy of water rapids along the East Lyn and Hoar Oak rivers, where they merge at Watersmeet. While in the county, Julia makes sure she finds time to enjoy a hard-earned cream tea.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Carla confesses to Peter that Jordan is trying to blackmail her. Adam is pleased to see Daniel having a good time with an attractive woman, and Alya tells Imran how she suspects Sally kicked Geoff out because underneath, she knows Yasmeen is innocent. However, Faye shows her support for Geoff.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Travis has serious school news that he is scared to break to his mum, so Sharon decides to pass herself off as Tracey and sort out his problems. However, her efforts only land the family in more trouble and it is left to Dorien to help out - using her skills of seduction. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson, Lesley Joseph and Charlie Quirke.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The body of a man killed by a single gunshot wound is discovered on the moors and a burnt-out truck containing the remains of a deer is found a mile away. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Following the recent death of his grandfather, he returned to Northumberland after a 15-year absence to sell his inheritance to a wealthy couple - but pulled out of the deal at the last minute. Could his death be linked to a dispute over land? Brenda Blethyn and David Leon star in the murder mystery.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: Actor Warwick Davis talks to Piers about his life and career, which includes supporting roles in both the Harry Potter and Star Wars films. The actor and presenter opens up about the struggles he and his wife Sam faced when starting a family and offers an entertaining and revealing account of some of the routine realities of life as a little person, including the challenges of supermarket shopping and airline travel. He also reflects on his leading roles alongside Jennifer Aniston, Val Kilmer and Ricky Gervais, and talks about his work to support other people with dwarfism.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they mine marble for Washington's monuments, how do they make Tabasco Sauce, and how do they produce storm proof umbrellas?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk on a classic Jaguar E-type in poor condition, but quickly discovers the expense of buying parts as Edd China gets to work.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie uncover a hidden stash of awesome motorcycle relics at a Colorado property littered with massive man-mobiles.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: On the Road - European Tour: Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The crew members continue their European holiday by meeting actor and fellow motorcycle fan Ewan McGregor. They also lead the annual Brighton Burn-Up rally.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: Ferno, Ayla and Ariel Tweto run with the reindeer, the Itarod dog sled race is held, a pilot battles malfunctioning controls and a tsunami warning is issued for the west coast.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe gets wet while shrink-wrapping a steel boat to protect it from winter weather, before heading to Alaska to wrangle reindeer.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacture of ball bearings, electric violins, photographs and welding electrodes, and how the processes have evolved over the years.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind glass bottles, hacksaws and ice hockey goalkeepers' masks.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Empire State Building/Extracting Copper/Making a Car
programme.desc: How the mast on top of the Empire State Building is repaired, and the techniques involved in extracting copper from the world's largest mine.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove head across the sea to Northern Ireland, searching for collections they've never seen before..

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: The adventure in Northern Ireland continues. Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove hunt down some army vehicles, tractors and some very well-hidden land rovers.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: With a reward of $100million at stake, the fishermen continue to hunt for crab in the Bering Sea.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats face an unexploded bomb and deadly gasses. The Bros attempt to rescue their season, and rookie team The Poms go underground for the first time.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The M4 is closed so diggers can demolish a bridge. Accidents pile up as scrapped engines in scrap vans are raced into oblivion in a final demolition derby.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer hopes to purchase a Lotus Elise, but is unsure how to add value to the car and enlists mechanic Edd China's help.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini helps a well-known customer trade his 1931 Cadillac for a Model A and the car restorer is impressed by an exceptional collection of classics.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini enjoys his Austin Cooper twin-engine Mini at Monterey and sells his 2001 MV Augusta F4 and 1967 275 GTB/4 Ferrari alloy body car at auction.

programme.title: Fifth Gear
programme.desc: The team hits the track to test out the new Volvo XC40. Plus, Jimmy de Ville goes back to the '80s to find out how Audi devised the revolutionary four-wheel drive system.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats face an unexploded bomb and deadly gasses. The Bros attempt to rescue their season, and rookie team The Poms go underground for the first time.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Jake's dark secret triggers a fist-fight that throws Edgar's new captaincy into jeopardy. Meanwhile, tempers flare when Elliott grows wise to Junior's devious ways. Documentary following the successes and failures of crewmen as they risk harsh conditions and fierce competition in the course of their work catching the valuable crustaceans.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A junkyard wizard has an Oktoberfest gem with Frank Fritz's name written all over it.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard scours a Cheshire barn packed with items, from traditional antique furniture to taxidermy. In Sheffield, he uncovers a collection of early 20th-century glass eyes.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, a community centre is crushed. Plus, in Berkshire a scrap artist works on a challenging new piece and in Coventry car parts are repurposed.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer takes a risk on a classic Jaguar E-type in poor condition, but quickly discovers the expense of buying parts as Edd China gets to work.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Boulder Boys Aaron and Ron almost lose their $60,000 excavator on unstable ground. Off-the-grid opal hunting family The McFarlanes race a storm in Lightning Ridge.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard explores an Aladdin's cave of magic carpets in Cumbria and royal biographer Colin Campbell reveals antiques with tragic history from her romantic castle.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: Following Nasa's discovery that something strange is on Saturn's largest moon, experts investigate the possibility of alien life feeding on electric atmosphere.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.desc: A missing mummified body could re-write the history of Abraham Lincoln's assassination, as Ramy Romany investigates whether John Wilkes Booth actually escaped.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how New York bagels are hand-rolled, how they make a racing car tyre that will grip the track at 320kph, and how life-like sculptures are created out of glass.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how waste is collected in Venice, how Australia's famous sheepskin boots are made, and how pond algae is turned into a health supplement.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers investigate when an armoured car robbery leaves three guards dead and another critically wounded, and it soon emerges heavily armed terrorists are to blame.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How professionals meticulously examine everyday items to establish evidence of guilt incriminating even the most meticulous of criminals.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: A case in which a husband and respected businessman left his home one morning and never returned. Investigators contemplated whether a business deal 'gone sour' was to blame. Plus, a case in which a young mother vanished while searching for work. Officers relied on surveillance cameras to provide them a lead to her whereabouts.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The 1996 investigation into the abduction of a 17-year-old from a shop near his home and the subsequent $30,000 ransom demands.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators from the Houston SPCA are called to a remote property, where they find five horses - one dead and four in poor health.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A West Highland Terrier called Chester dislikes skateboarders. Concerned that he will bite someone, his owners take him to see Chris to see if he can help tame him.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride wants short and revealing dresses for her bridesmaids but must convince her religious mother and sister. Plus, another bride struggles to make a decision without her mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Say No to the Ball Gown
programme.desc: A bride searches for anything but a pageant dress in defiance of her mother, while another continues the hunt after trying on 100 mermaid gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride is torn between her own vision and that of her family, while another shares her bittersweet appointment with her terminally ill father.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three rivals head to sun-drenched Nice on the Cote D'Azur in search of bargains they hope to sell on for a profit back in the UK. Back home they upcycle some of their purchases before selling on in Tunbridge Wells, Kent. Painter and decorator Jane transforms some old side tables, Ish breathes new life into some rusty day beds, and Tania revamps a shabby bookcase covered in mermaids.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants 10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The SPCA seizes a hoard of sick animals, including several roosters, a goat and a pregnant cat. Plus, investigator Scott Wernick confiscates numerous dogs that have been left to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team tries to rescue more than 100 animals, including 50 dogs, from some of the worst living conditions its members have witnessed.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three murder investigations involving poison, including arsenic and potassium chloride - one of which requires toxicology tests on frozen tissue from the victim.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of avid scuba diver Ben McDaniel, who in August 2010, slipped beneath the clear waters of Vortex Spring, Florida, intent on making a name for himself in the extreme world of cave diving. However, he was never seen again. The caves are known to have claimed the lives of other divers, but Ben's body was never recovered.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 18-year-old Zebb Quinn, who went missing in January 2000 shortly after completing his shift at a supermarket in Asheville, North Carolina.

programme.title: Dateline with Tamzin Outhwaite
programme.desc: The actress looks behind the headlines at the baffling mysteries, cold cases and compelling real-life dramas to uncover what really happened.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A family bickers and does not listen to what the bride wants. Plus, a mother demands her daughter's custom gown be redesigned.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: On a day that Kleinfeld is closed to the public, dress designer Pnina Tornai meets with VIP clients for exclusive appointments to discuss their dress dreams.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The store holds a three-hour sale, and over 200 women flood the store looking for the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A demanding dad dominates his daughter's shopping trip, while another father of the bride expects answers when a custom fitting goes wrong.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I've Stalked This Dress on Instagram!
programme.desc: Hayley Paige makes three unique dress in one day, while a bride is determined to have her design a gown for her big day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Am a Bride on a Budget
programme.desc: A struggling actress resolves to pay for her own dress, while a customer falls in love with a dress that is over her budget.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: The Court Said No, We Were Too Young
programme.desc: After a life of longing, a couple are now desperate to find the son they placed for adoption 50 years earlier when they were teenagers.

programme.title: How to Look Good Naked
programme.desc: Gok Wan helps Jade and her aunt Sadie rebuild their body confidence after battling cancer, setting out a radical agenda to get them loving themselves again.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: How, in the summer of 2014, a drink thrown in a Manchester nightclub triggered a gangland feud that caused years of ruthless violence, with deadly consequences.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: The crimes of Eddie Sexton, who compelled his children to murder and committing sexual abuse against his own family, which he ruled in a cult-like manner.

programme.title: My Murder Story
programme.desc: A series of mysterious deaths have plagued a small community in Kansas. The thorough investigation of one determined detective reveals a sinister secret..
